body_text.text: Huh7-Lunet cells. Cells were seeded and harvested as described recently (2) . The protocols for measurement of Firefly and Renilla-luciferase activity were described elsewhere (3) .

Colony formation assay. Huh7-Lunet cells were electroporated with 1, 0.1 or 0.025µg in vitro transcribed RNA of blasticidin-selectable HAV or HCV replicon constructs (BlrHAV, BlrCon1) or respective replication-deficient controls (BlrHAVmut, BlrCon1GND). Cells were seeded on 10cm culture-dishes and medium containing 2.5µg/ml blasticidin (Thermo Fisher Scientific, Darmstadt, Germany) was replaced twice per week. After two (BlrCon1) or three (BlrHAV) weeks, when control-plates were empty, colonies were stained with Coomassie-Brilliant-Blue solution and counted with the multi-point tool of ImageJ software (Maryland, USA).

To control for cell viability with cell proliferation reagent WST-1 (Roche, Germany), Huh7-Lunet cells were seeded in triplicates (10000 cells per well) on a 96well plate. A detailed description of the protocol is included in (2) .

body_text.text: Generation of PI4KIIIβ knockout cells. Huh7-Lunet cells stably expressing T7polymerase under zeocin-selection have been described before (5) . Single guide RNAs (sgRNA) for CRISPR-Cas9-mediated knockout of PI4KIIIβ were designed using the Ecrisp online tool (www.e-crisp.org). Lyophilized oligonucleotides (Sigma-Aldrich, Steinheim, Germany) harboring the sgRNA sequence (TGCACTGAGGAATGCCTCAGTGG) and additional 5' (CACC) or 3' (CAAA) restriction site overhangs for BsmBI were resuspended at 50µM in 5mM Tris-HCl and boiled for 5min at 95°C before slowly cooling down to room temperature for nucleotide annealing.

FIGREF1.text: and transduced Huh7-Lunet T7 cells were selected using 2µg/ml puromycin. The selected cell population typically represents a pool of cells with varying knockout efficiencies depending on the number of defective gene alleles after cleavage by Cas9 and religation. To obtain clones with complete PI4KIIIβ knockout, single cells were seeded together with naïve Huh7-Lunet cells in 96-well plates. After 48h, puromycin was added to remove the non-resistant cells and the remaining clonal colonies were cultivated and expanded. PI4KIIIβ levels in the obtained cell clones were analyzed by Western-Blotting using monoclonal mouse antibodies directed against PI4KIIIβ (BD Bioscience) or β-Actin (Sigma-Aldrich, Steinheim, Germany), respectively. The blot was documented with an INTAS ECL ChemoCam Imager (INTAS Science Imaging, Germany). Immunofluorescence. Huh7-Lunet cells were seeded on glass coverslips upon coelectroporation with F-LucHAV and R-LucJFH or R-LucJFH Xtail Con1 or mock electroporation. Alternatively, Huh7-Lunet T7 cells (stably expressing T7 polymerase) were seeded onto glass coverslips and transfected 24h later with expression plasmids pTM_2A-3D_HAV or pTM_NS3-5B_HCV (gt2a, JFH1) by using TransTILT1 transfection reagent (Mirus, Bio, LLC, Madison, WI) according to the instructions of the manufacturer. The protocol used for immunofluorescence has been described before (5). In brief, cells were fixed for 15min using 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) followed by permeabilization with 50µg/ml digitonin for 15min at room temperature. Upon blocking for 20min with PBS containing 3% bovine serum albumin (BSA), coverslips were incubated with mouse monoclonal 9E10 (generous gift of Charles M. Rice and Timothy Tellinghuisen) specific for HCV NS5A, rabbit polyclonal anti-3C antibody (7) and labeled secondary antibodies (goat-anti-rabbit conjugated to Alexa-Fluor 488, donkey-antimouse conjugated to Alexa-Fluor 568 (both Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany)). For labelling of mitochondria, MitoTracker (Invitrogen) was added at a dilution of 1:10.000 to the cells prior to fixation and incubated for 30min at 37°C. Samples were mounted in Fluoromount G (Southern Biotechnology Associates, Birmingham, AL, USA). Pictures of the samples were taken at a Leica SP2 microscope equipped with a 63x oil immersion objective using the Leica Confocal software LCS (Leica, Heidelberg, Germany) and merged using Fiji software (NIH). For quantitative analysis of colocalization at least 14 cells per condition were analyzed. Colocalization was determined with the intensity correlation analysis function of Fiji software. Statistical data analysis was performed with the Graph-Pad Prism 5 software package using the unpaired t test (GraphPad Software,Inc., La Jolla, CA) as described before(2).

Huh6 cells were electroporated with the indicated replicon RNAs and luciferase activity was measured 4, 24, 48 and 72h later (r.l.u.) and normalized to the 4h value. Depicted are the mean and SD of two independent experiments performed with triplicates. Data are presented in logarithmic scale. (n=2). Note that the replication-deficient HAVmut is used as negative control. (B) The indicated reporter replicons were electroporated either alone or together with the miR122 antagonist mirVana or the mutant miR122_A4U into Huh7-Lunet cells. Replication (luciferase activity, r.l.u.) was determined 4, 24, 48 and 72h upon electroporation. Data are derived from two independent experiments performed in triplicates and depicted in logarithmic scale. The graph shows mean and SD of raw data (r.l.u.) because miR122 impacts on HCV translation. (n=2) Cytostatic effects of different reagents on Huh7-Lunet cells. (A) Huh7-Lunet cells were treated for 48h with different inhibitors at the indicated concentrations. Note that all concentrations are given in [µM] with exception of DMSO [%]. 48h after addition of different compounds, cell proliferation reagent WST-1 was added and incubated at 37°C. To determine the number of viable cells, absorbance at 450nm was measured 30 and 60min later. Data are derived from two independent experiments performed in triplicates and normalized to the untreated control (wo). A drug concentration was assessed as cytostatic, when the absorbance dropped below 80%. (n=2) HAV RNA replication is independent of CypA but sensitive to the ABCtransporter inhibitor PSC833. (A) Huh7-Lunet cells either expressing a non-targeting shRNA (shONT) or a shRNA targeting CypA were electroporated with the indicated reporter replicons. Replication was measured 4, 24, 48 and 72h after electroporation and normalized to the 4h value. The graph shows mean and SD of two independent experiments performed with triplicates. Data are depicted in logarithmic scale. (n=2) (B) Huh7-Lunet cells were electroporated with HAV or HCV subgenomic reporter replicons. 4h p.t. cells were treated with the indicated concentrations of PSC833. 48h after treatment cells were lysed to measure luciferase activity. Note, that the number of viable cells was reduced to 60% by 8µM of PSC833 (also Figure S2). The graph shows mean and SD of two independent experiments performed with triplicates and normalized to the untreated control. Data are depicted in logarithmic scale. (n=2) Viral non-structural proteins 5A (HCV) and 3C (HAV) do not colocalize upon coexpression. (A and B) The lower panels represent magnifications of the boxed areas, with arrows indicating the lines used for plot profile analyses represented on the right. Scale bars, 10µm. (A) Immunofluorescence analysis of Huh7-Lunet T7 cells 24h upon cotransfection with plasmids encoding HCV NS3-5B or HAV 2A-3D, using mouse monoclonal anti-NS5A antibody and rabbit polyclonal anti-3C antibody. (B) 24h upon transfection of Huh7-Lunet cells with HAV 2A-3D, mitochondria were labeled with MitoTracker and immunofluorescence was performed using rabbit polyclonal anti-3C antibody. (C) Colocalization analysis for HCV-5A / HAV-3C (left) and mitochondria / HAV-3C (right). The graph depicts mean and SD of the Pearson correlation coefficient (Rr) of at least 14 analyzed cells per condition. ***, p<0.0001
